alerts.headline: squall warning ended
alerts.description:
Squalls have weakened or moved out of the area.


###

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
A line of strong to severe thunderstorms is moving northeast across the region this evening.

What:
Severe wind gusts up to 100 km/h.
A brief tornado possible.

When:
This evening.

###

Driving conditions may be difficult. Utility outages are possible. Significant damage to property, buildings and trees is possible.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year. Secure loose objects.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

affected_areas.area_description: Watford - Pinery Park - Eastern Lambton County
St. Thomas - Aylmer - Eastern Elgin County

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots are expected or occurring in the area.

A line of thunderstorms located from 6 nautical miles east of Morpeth to 24 nautical miles southeast of Port Glasgow, is moving northeast at 35 knots.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately.

alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
A line of thunderstorms will move through later this evening and overnight, which may produce wind gusts up to 35 knots.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

alerts.headline: squall warning ended
alerts.description:
Squalls have weakened or moved out of the area.


###

alerts.headline: squall watch ended
alerts.description:
Squalls are no longer expected over the area.


###

alerts.headline: special air quality statement ended
alerts.description:
Smoke is no longer expected or has moved out of the area.


###

affected_areas.area_description: Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake
Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch ended
alerts.description:
Conditions are no longer favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms.


###

affected_areas.area_description: Watford - Pinery Park - Eastern Lambton County
St. Thomas - Aylmer - Eastern Elgin County

alerts.headline: squall watch ended
alerts.description:
Squalls are no longer expected over the area.


###

alerts.headline: rainfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Heavy rainfall continues.

What:
Local rainfall amounts of 40 to 60 mm.

When:
Continuing through this afternoon.

Additional information:
Rain, at times heavy, and possible embedded thunderstorms are expected to taper to showers later today.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

affected_areas.area_description: Deep River - Whitney - Eastern Algonquin Park
Western Algonquin Park - Lake of Two Rivers
Town of Parry Sound - Rosseau - Killbear Park

alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
Thunderstorms are possible this afternoon with the development of squalls producing wind gusts up to 50 knots.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for potential squalls. Vulnerable vessels are most at risk and should seek safe harbour if underway. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the Squall Watch.

alerts.headline: frost advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Frost is expected tonight as temperatures drop to or below zero degrees Celsius. 

Some plants may be damaged or destroyed by frost.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Take preventative measures to protect frost-sensitive plants and trees.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
